- [BMG](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMG_Rights_Management "BMG Rights Management") | | Website | [lennykravitz.com](http://lennykravitz.com/) | | Musical artist | **Leonard Albert Kravitz** (born May 26, 1964) is an American singer, musician, songwriter, record producer, and actor. His debut album _[Let Love Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Let_Love_Rule_(Lenny_Kravitz_album) "Let Love Rule (Lenny Kravitz album)")_ (1989) was characterized by a blend of [rock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_music "Rock music"), [funk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funk "Funk"), [reggae](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reggae "Reggae"), [hard rock](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hard_rock "Hard rock"), [soul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soul_music "Soul music"), and [R&B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_and_blues "Rhythm and blues"), along with his subsequent releases. Kravitz has had hit singles, including " [It Ain't Over 'til It's Over](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It_Ain%27t_Over_%27til_It%27s_Over "It Ain't Over 'til It's Over")" (1991) and " [Again](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Again_(Lenny_Kravitz_song) "Again (Lenny Kravitz song)")" (2000), both of which peaked within the [_Billboard_ Hot 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100")'s top ten. His other hits include " [Let Love Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Let_Love_Rule_(song) "Let Love Rule (song)")" (1989), " [Always on the Run](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Always_on_the_Run_(Lenny_Kravitz_song) "Always on the Run (Lenny Kravitz song)")" (1991), " [Are You Gonna Go My Way](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Are_You_Gonna_Go_My_Way_(song) "Are You Gonna Go My Way (song)")" (1993), " [Fly Away](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fly_Away_(Lenny_Kravitz_song) "Fly Away (Lenny Kravitz song)")" (1998), and " [American Woman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Woman#Lenny_Kravitz_version "American Woman")" (1999), all of which peaked within the top ten of the [Alternative Airplay](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alternative_Airplay "Alternative Airplay") chart. Kravitz has won several awards, including the [Grammy Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award "Grammy Award") for [Best Male Rock Vocal Performance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_Male_Rock_Vocal_Performance "Grammy Award for Best Male Rock Vocal Performance"), which he received four years in a row from 1999 to 2002,[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-grammy-2) breaking the record for most wins in that category, and setting the record for most consecutive wins in one category by a male performer. Kravitz has sold over 40 million albums worldwide and was ranked 93 on [VH1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VH1 "VH1")'s "100 Greatest Artists of Hard Rock".[\[3\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-3) Aside from his music career, Kravitz has acted in films including [_Precious_](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precious_(film) "Precious (film)") (2009) and the first two installments of [_The Hunger Games_ film series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hunger_Games_(film_series) "The Hunger Games (film series)") (2012–13). In addition, he also founded the creative studio Kravitz Design Inc. Kravitz was previously married to [Lisa Bonet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisa_Bonet "Lisa Bonet"), with whom he has a daughter, [Zoë Kravitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz "Zoë Kravitz"). ## Early life Kravitz was born on May 26, 1964, in [New York City](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City "New York City"),[\[4\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-4) the only child of [NBC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBC "NBC") television news producer Sy Kravitz (1924–2005) and actress [Roxie Roker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roxie_Roker "Roxie Roker") (1929–1995).[\[5\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-5) His mother came from a [Christian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christianity "Christianity") family that was of African-American and Bahamian descent.[\[6\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-8)[\[9\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-9) His grandfather was [Russian-Jewish](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian-Jewish "Russian-Jewish").[\[10\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-10)[\[11\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-11)[\[12\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-12)\[ _[disputed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Disputed_statement "Wikipedia:Disputed statement") – [discuss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Lenny_Kravitz "Talk:Lenny Kravitz")_\] Kravitz's paternal grandparents emigrated to the United States from [Kyiv](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyiv "Kyiv").[\[13\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-13) Through his mother, Kravitz is a [second cousin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_cousin "Second cousin") of television weather presenter [Al Roker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_Roker "Al Roker"),[\[14\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-14) as their grandfathers were brothers.[\[15\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-15) Kravitz was named after his uncle, [Leonard M. Kravitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_M._Kravitz "Leonard M. Kravitz"), a [private first class](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Private_first_class "Private first class") who was killed in action in the [Korean War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_War "Korean War") at the age of 20, while single-handedly holding off a Chinese attack, enabling most of his platoon to escape.[\[16\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-Medal-16)[\[a\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-18) During his early years, Kravitz did not grow up in a religious environment.[\[18\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-telgjuly-19) After a spiritual experience when he was 13, he started attending church and later became a [non-denominational Christian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nondenominational_Christianity "Nondenominational Christianity").[\[18\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-telgjuly-19)[\[19\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-20) Kravitz grew up spending weekdays on the [Upper East Side](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Upper_East_Side "Upper East Side") of Manhattan with his parents, attending [P.S. 6](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P.S._6 "P.S. 6") for elementary school, and spending weekends at his grandmother Bessie's house in the [Bedford-Stuyvesant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bedford-Stuyvesant,_Brooklyn "Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn") neighborhood of [Brooklyn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brooklyn "Brooklyn").[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) Kravitz began banging on pots and pans in the kitchen, playing them as drums at the age of three. He decided that he wanted to be a musician at the age of five. He began playing the drums and soon added guitar. He grew up listening to the music his parents listened to: [R&B](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhythm_and_blues "Rhythm and blues"), [jazz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jazz "Jazz"), classical, opera, [gospel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gospel_music "Gospel music"), and [blues](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blues "Blues"). He said, "My parents were very supportive of the fact that I loved music early on, and they took me to a lot of shows."[\[21\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-22)[\[22\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-Henderson2002-23) Around the age of seven, he saw [the Jackson 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jackson_5 "The Jackson 5") perform at [Madison Square Garden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden "Madison Square Garden"), and they became his favorite performers.[\[23\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-guardian2002-24) His father, who was a jazz promoter, was friends with [Duke Ellington](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duke_Ellington "Duke Ellington"), [Sarah Vaughan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarah_Vaughan "Sarah Vaughan"), [Count Basie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Count_Basie "Count Basie"), [Ella Fitzgerald](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ella_Fitzgerald "Ella Fitzgerald"), [Bobby Short](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bobby_Short "Bobby Short"), [Miles Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Davis "Miles Davis"), and other jazz greats; Ellington played "Happy Birthday" for him on his fifth birthday.[\[24\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-25)[\[25\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ebony1994-26)[\[26\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-27) In 1974, at the age of 10, Kravitz relocated to Los Angeles with his parents when his mother landed her role on _[The Jeffersons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jeffersons "The Jeffersons")_.[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) At his mother's urging, he joined the California Boys Choir for three years, where he performed a classical repertoire, and sang with the [Metropolitan Opera](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Opera "Metropolitan Opera"). He took part in [Mahler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gustav_Mahler "Gustav Mahler")'s [Third Symphony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symphony_No._3_(Mahler) "Symphony No. 3 (Mahler)") at the [Hollywood Bowl](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Bowl "Hollywood Bowl").[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) It was in Los Angeles that Kravitz was introduced to rock music, listening to [the Beatles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Beatles "The Beatles"), [the Rolling Stones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rolling_Stones "The Rolling Stones"), [Led Zeppelin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Led_Zeppelin "Led Zeppelin"), [Jimi Hendrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix "Jimi Hendrix"), the [Grateful Dead](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grateful_Dead "Grateful Dead"), [Aerosmith](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aerosmith "Aerosmith"), [Black Sabbath](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sabbath "Black Sabbath"), [Creedence Clearwater Revival](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creedence_Clearwater_Revival "Creedence Clearwater Revival"), [Kiss](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiss_(band) "Kiss (band)"), [Pink Floyd](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pink_Floyd "Pink Floyd"), and [the Who](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Who "The Who"),[\[23\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-guardian2002-24) and he said he was "attracted to the cool style, the girls, the rock 'n' roll lifestyle."[\[23\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-guardian2002-24) During his junior high school years, he was also introduced to marijuana; he has stated that he was a "pothead" during his youth.[\[27\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-28) His other musical influences at the time included [Fela Kuti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fela_Kuti "Fela Kuti"), [Bill Withers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Withers "Bill Withers"), [Marvin Gaye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvin_Gaye "Marvin Gaye"), [Pharoah Sanders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharoah_Sanders "Pharoah Sanders"), and [Miles Davis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miles_Davis "Miles Davis").[\[23\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-guardian2002-24) Later influences came in the form of [John Lennon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon "John Lennon") and [Bob Marley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Marley "Bob Marley"). Kravitz attended [Beverly Hills High School](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beverly_Hills_High_School "Beverly Hills High School"), where he was classmates with [Maria McKee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_McKee "Maria McKee"), [Nicolas Cage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicolas_Cage "Nicolas Cage"), and [Slash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slash_(musician) "Slash (musician)"). He taught himself to play piano and bass and made friends with [Zoro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoro_(drummer) "Zoro (drummer)"), who would later become his long-time collaborator.[\[28\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-29) His parents divorced in 1985.[\[29\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-30) ## Career ### 1985–1990: Virgin Records and career debut With record labels reportedly telling him his music was not "black enough" or "white enough", Kravitz decided to record an album on his own under the name Romeo Blue.[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) Kravitz had met the recording engineer, keyboardist, and bassist Henry Hirsch in 1985 when recording a demo at his [Hoboken, New Jersey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoboken,_New_Jersey "Hoboken, New Jersey"), recording studio. The two shared an interest in using real instruments and vintage recording equipment, as well as a love of R&B, jazz, and rock. Kravitz would go on to collaborate with Hirsch on most of his albums. Kravitz began working on his debut album with Hirsch over the next year and a half, with Kravitz's father paying for the studio time. Kravitz met saxophonist [Karl Denson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Denson "Karl Denson") and invited him to play on the song " [Let Love Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Let_Love_Rule_(song) "Let Love Rule (song)")". Kravitz was so impressed with his playing that Denson played on much of the album. Beginning in the late 1980s, Denson toured with Kravitz for five years.[\[30\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-31) In October 1988, after completing most of the recording, Kravitz approached friend Stephen Elvis Smith, who had served as the music supervisor on [Lisa Bonet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisa_Bonet "Lisa Bonet")'s _[The Cosby Show](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Cosby_Show "The Cosby Show")_ spin-off _[A Different World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Different_World "A Different World")_. Smith had also worked with Kravitz's mother on the hit sitcom _[The Jeffersons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Jeffersons "The Jeffersons")_. Kravitz urged Smith to manage his career and assist him in finding a record deal. In less than a month of shopping the recordings, five labels (Warner Bros, Elektra, Geffen, Capitol, and Virgin) were in a bidding war for Kravitz. Eventually, a deal was made with Virgin Records in January 1989, and signed by Virgin A&R executive Nancy Jeffries. The label was "excited" about the music he was making, music inspired by his relationship with wife Bonet and their new daughter, Zoe. On Smith's urging, Kravitz dropped the name Romeo Blue and reclaimed the Lenny Kravitz moniker. About his time as Romeo Blue, Kravitz said, "Ultimately, it got me back to myself. And when I finally did accept myself for myself, music started flowing out of me."[\[22\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-Henderson2002-23) Kravitz released his debut album _[Let Love Rule](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Let_Love_Rule_(Lenny_Kravitz_album) "Let Love Rule (Lenny Kravitz album)")_ in 1989, a combination of rock and funk with a 1960s vibe. Music critics were mixed: some felt Kravitz was a gifted new artist, others felt he was overpowered by his musical influences. The album was a moderate success in the United States, but became an instant hit outside of the US, especially in Europe. Lisa Bonet directed the debut music video for the title track, "Let Love Rule". Stephen Smith signed Kravitz with talent booking agency CAA, who soon were fielding offers for Kravitz, first on a club tour, and then in opening slots for [Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Petty_%26_the_Heartbreakers "Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers"), [Bob Dylan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Dylan "Bob Dylan"), and David Bowie. Having played essentially all of the instruments on the album, Kravitz had to quickly assemble a touring band to support the _Let Love Rule_ release. In May 2009, a 20th-anniversary deluxe edition of _Let Love Rule_ was released worldwide by Virgin. Kravitz launched a LLR(20) tour of Europe and the United States in support of the re-release.[\[31\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-32)[\[32\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-33)[\[33\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-34) ### 1991–2001: Popularity established [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Lenny_Kravitz_-_Craig_Ross_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_02.jpg/250px-Lenny_Kravitz_-_Craig_Ross_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_02.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lenny_Kravitz_-_Craig_Ross_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_02.jpg) Kravitz and [Craig Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Craig_Ross "Craig Ross") during a concert In 1990, Kravitz produced the song " [Justify My Love](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justify_My_Love "Justify My Love")" for [Madonna](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madonna_(entertainer) "Madonna (entertainer)"), which he co-wrote with [Ingrid Chavez](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ingrid_Chavez "Ingrid Chavez").[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) The song appeared on her greatest hits album _[The Immaculate Collection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Immaculate_Collection "The Immaculate Collection")_. Kravitz separated from Lisa Bonet in 1991,[\[34\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-behindthemusic-35) amid rumors of an affair between him and Madonna. Kravitz has denied any infidelity.[\[34\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-behindthemusic-35) Kravitz and Bonet divorced in 1993. Kravitz produced the self-titled album _[Vanessa Paradis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanessa_Paradis_(album) "Vanessa Paradis (album)")_ (1991) for French singer and actress [Vanessa Paradis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanessa_Paradis "Vanessa Paradis"). He played most of the instruments and co-wrote most of the songs on the album. In 1991, Kravitz released his second album, _[Mama Said](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mama_Said_(album) "Mama Said (album)")_. The songs on the album were about Bonet and documented his depression over their breakup.[\[25\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ebony1994-26) The single, " [It Ain't Over 'til It's Over](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It_Ain%27t_Over_%27til_It%27s_Over "It Ain't Over 'til It's Over")", went to number 2 on the [_Billboard_ Hot 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billboard_Hot_100 "Billboard Hot 100"). A second single " [Always on the Run](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Always_on_the_Run_(Lenny_Kravitz_song) "Always on the Run (Lenny Kravitz song)")", a tribute to his mother,[\[25\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ebony1994-26) featured [Slash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slash_(musician) "Slash (musician)") on guitar. "Stand by My Woman" and "What Goes Around Comes Around" followed. [Sean Lennon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sean_Lennon "Sean Lennon") co-wrote and played piano on the song "All I Ever Wanted".[\[20\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-:0-21) In 1994, Kravitz recorded "Main Squeeze" with [Teena Marie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teena_Marie "Teena Marie") from her _Passion Play_ CD. Kravitz also made a video to pay tribute to Teena Marie when she suddenly died on December 26, 2010. He recorded a funk-rock version of the song " [Deuce](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deuce_(song) "Deuce (song)")" for the [KISS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiss_(band) "Kiss (band)") cover album _[Kiss My Ass: Classic Kiss Regrooved](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiss_My_Ass:_Classic_Kiss_Regrooved "Kiss My Ass: Classic Kiss Regrooved")_. The track featured [Stevie Wonder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stevie_Wonder "Stevie Wonder") on harmonica and background vocals.[\[35\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-36) With _[5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/5_(Lenny_Kravitz_album) "5 (Lenny Kravitz album)")_ (1998), Kravitz won the first of his four consecutive [Grammy for Best Male Rock Vocal Performance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Award_for_Best_Male_Rock_Vocal_Performance "Grammy Award for Best Male Rock Vocal Performance") at the [Grammy Awards of 1999](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Awards_of_1999 "Grammy Awards of 1999").[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-grammy-2) In 1999 he produced and sang with [Cree Summer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cree_Summer "Cree Summer") on her solo album [Street Faërie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street_Fa%C3%ABrie "Street Faërie"). His cover version of [the Guess Who](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Guess_Who "The Guess Who")'s hit " [American Woman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Woman_(song) "American Woman (song)")" won him another Grammy at the [Grammy Awards of 2000](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Awards_of_2000 "Grammy Awards of 2000")[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-grammy-2) and helped the Guess Who's song reach a new audience. Kravitz's version of the song originally came from the soundtrack of _[Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Austin_Powers:_The_Spy_Who_Shagged_Me "Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me")_ and was added to _5_ as a bonus track in 1999. Kravitz worked on two songs for [Michael Jackson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Jackson "Michael Jackson")'s _[Invincible](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invincible_(Michael_Jackson_album) "Invincible (Michael Jackson album)")_ album released in 2001; a snippet of " [Another Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Another_Day_(Michael_Jackson_song) "Another Day (Michael Jackson song)")" was leaked, and the full version was officially released on the album _[Michael](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_(Michael_Jackson_album) "Michael (Michael Jackson album)")_ in 2010.[\[36\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-37) Kravitz released a _[Greatest Hits](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greatest_Hits_(Lenny_Kravitz_album) "Greatest Hits (Lenny Kravitz album)")_ album in 2000. The single " [Again](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Again_(Lenny_Kravitz_song) "Again (Lenny Kravitz song)")" earned him his third consecutive Grammy for the Best Male Rock Vocal in the [Grammy Awards of 2001](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grammy_Awards_of_2001 "Grammy Awards of 2001"). ### 2006–2009: Live Earth, charity work, and _It Is Time for a Love Revolution_ [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_29_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_29_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_29_(cropped).jpg) Kravitz performing in 2012 In January 2006, Kravitz contributed "Breathe" to absoluttracks, a project sponsored by [Absolut Vodka](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absolut_Vodka "Absolut Vodka"). This song was re-mixed by ten musical producers and distributed via the internet. Kravitz appeared in the audience of Madonna's [Confessions Tour](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confessions_Tour "Confessions Tour") (2006) during numerous shows. He later joined Madonna live on stage to play guitar on the song, "I Love New York", at the last of four Paris shows. Kravitz founded a design firm named Kravitz Design, stating if he hadn't been a musician he would have been a designer. Kravitz Design, focused on interior and furniture design, has designed residential spaces, as well as a chandelier for the crystal company [Swarovski](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swarovski "Swarovski"), named "Casino Royale".[\[37\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-38) On July 7, 2007, Kravitz performed at the [Brazilian leg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Earth_concert,_Rio_de_Janeiro "Live Earth concert, Rio de Janeiro") of [Live Earth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Earth "Live Earth") in Rio de Janeiro,[\[38\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-39) making him one of three major international rock stars to perform two huge free concerts at the world-famous [Copacabana Beach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copacabana_(Rio_de_Janeiro) "Copacabana (Rio de Janeiro)") along with Macy Gray and the Rolling Stones. Kravitz had already played there on March 21, 2005, drawing 300,000 people on a concert of his own. The Live Earth concert, with eight other acts on the bill, including [Pharrell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pharrell "Pharrell") and [Macy Gray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macy_Gray "Macy Gray") had an audience of 400,000 on the beach. Also in 2007, Kravitz released a version of " [Cold Turkey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold_Turkey "Cold Turkey")" by [John Lennon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lennon "John Lennon") on the charity CD _[Instant Karma: The Amnesty International Campaign to Save Darfur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instant_Karma:_The_Amnesty_International_Campaign_to_Save_Darfur "Instant Karma: The Amnesty International Campaign to Save Darfur")_. Kravitz also spent time recording his latest album, _[It Is Time for a Love Revolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It_Is_Time_for_a_Love_Revolution "It Is Time for a Love Revolution")_, released February 5, 2008.[\[39\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-40) On September 25, 2007, the [Fats Domino](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fats_Domino "Fats Domino") tribute album _Goin' Home; A Tribute To Fats Domino_ was released. Kravitz was on the song "Whole Lotta Lovin'" along with [Rebirth Brass Band](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rebirth_Brass_Band "Rebirth Brass Band"), [Troy "Trombone Shorty" Andrews](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trombone_Shorty "Trombone Shorty"), [Fred Wesley](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fred_Wesley "Fred Wesley"), [Pee Wee Ellis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pee_Wee_Ellis "Pee Wee Ellis"), and [Maceo Parker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maceo_Parker "Maceo Parker").[\[40\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-41) Kravitz made his feature film acting debut in _[Precious](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Precious_(film) "Precious (film)")_[\[41\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-varietyoct07-42) which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in January 2009.[\[42\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-varietydec08-43) ### 2009–2011: U2 tour and _Black and White America_ [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_32.jpg/250px-Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_32.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Lenny_Kravitz_-_Rock_in_Rio_Madrid_2012_-_32.jpg) Kravitz performing in 2012 In June 2010 it was announced that Kravitz would guest star on an episode of the upcoming season of _[Entourage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entourage_(U.S._TV_series) "Entourage (U.S. TV series)")_.[\[43\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-44) In 2011 Kravitz was honored with one of the highest cultural awards in France when he was made an Officer of the [Ordre des Arts et des Lettres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ordre_des_Arts_et_des_Lettres "Ordre des Arts et des Lettres") by French cultural minister Frederic Mitterrand in Paris. Kravitz stated he was "particularly touched" to receive the award in France as his success in the country pre-dated his success in the United States and still enjoys great record sales in the country today.[\[44\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-45) Kravitz joined other American recipients such as [Martin Scorsese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Scorsese "Martin Scorsese"), [George Clooney](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Clooney "George Clooney"), and Bob Dylan. On February 26, 2012, he performed at the Daytona International Speedway for the Daytona 500, the opening race of the 2012 NASCAR Sprint Cup season. A sample of "Are You Gonna Go My Way" was used in American singer [Chris Willis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Willis "Chris Willis")'s single "Too Much In Love", released on August 16, 2011.[\[45\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-46) ### 2012–present: _The Hunger Games_ films, Super Bowl performance, and further albums [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Katy_Perry_-_Super_Bowl_XLIX_Halftime_05.jpg/250px-Katy_Perry_-_Super_Bowl_XLIX_Halftime_05.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Katy_Perry_-_Super_Bowl_XLIX_Halftime_05.jpg) Kravitz performing with [Katy Perry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katy_Perry "Katy Perry") at the [Super Bowl XLIX halftime show](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_XLIX_halftime_show "Super Bowl XLIX halftime show") Lenny Kravitz played the part of Katniss' creative stylist, Cinna, in the first two _Hunger Games_ films, _[The Hunger Games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hunger_Games_(film) "The Hunger Games (film)")_ released on March 23, 2012[\[46\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-47) and _[The Hunger Games: Catching Fire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Hunger_Games:_Catching_Fire "The Hunger Games: Catching Fire")_ released on November 22, 2013. In 2014 Lenny Kravitz released his tenth studio album _[Strut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Strut_(album) "Strut (album)")_ on his own Roxie Records via [Kobalt Label Services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kobalt_Label_Services "Kobalt Label Services").[\[47\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-48) In 2015, Kravitz performed alongside [Katy Perry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katy_Perry "Katy Perry") at the [Super Bowl XLIX halftime show](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_XLIX_halftime_show "Super Bowl XLIX halftime show").[\[48\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-49)[\[49\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-50) During an August 2015 show in Stockholm, Kravitz experienced a wardrobe malfunction. His leather pants ripped open, exposing his penis.[\[50\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-51)[\[51\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-52) As a designer, Kravitz launched a furniture collection in partnership with CB2 in 2015.[\[52\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-53) [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/DNC_2016_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpeg/250px-DNC_2016_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpeg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:DNC_2016_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpeg) Kravitz performing at the [2016 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_Democratic_National_Convention "2016 Democratic National Convention") In 2015, he became a furniture designer for the first time ever launching a collection of furniture products marketed under the label CB2 x Kravitz design through retailer CB2.[\[53\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-54) The collection was apparently inspired by the 70s and by the work of Italian designer [Gabriella Crespi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gabriella_Crespi "Gabriella Crespi").[\[54\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-55) The _Raise Vibration_ world tour[\[55\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-56) (2018) coincided with the release of his 11th studio album.[\[56\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-57)[\[57\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-auto-58) In April 2018, Kravitz signed with [BMG Rights Management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BMG_Rights_Management "BMG Rights Management") for a new worldwide publishing music deal to go with his new album _[Raise Vibration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raise_Vibration "Raise Vibration")_, released in September 2018.[\[58\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-59) BMG had acquired Kravitz's music publishing rights in 2013, as part of [Virgin Music Publishing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virgin_Records "Virgin Records").[\[59\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-60) [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Untold_2024_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpg/250px-Untold_2024_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Untold_2024_-_Lenny_Kravitz.jpg) Kravitz performing at [Untold Festival](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Untold_Festival "Untold Festival") in 2024 In 2023, Kravitz wrote and performed a song for the film _[Rustin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rustin_(film) "Rustin (film)")_ entitled "Road to Freedom". The song was nominated for a [Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Globe_Award_for_Best_Original_Song "Golden Globe Award for Best Original Song").[\[60\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-61) In December 2023, the [Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_of_Motion_Picture_Arts_and_Sciences "Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences") announced shortlists for the [96th Oscars ceremony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/96th_Academy_Awards "96th Academy Awards"), and "Road to Freedom" was included in the [Best Original Song](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Original_Song "Academy Award for Best Original Song") category.[\[61\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-62) Kravitz won Music Icon of the Year at the [49th People's Choice Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/49th_People%27s_Choice_Awards "49th People's Choice Awards").[\[62\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-63) In March 2024, he received a star on the [Hollywood Walk of Fame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame "Hollywood Walk of Fame"). On May 24, 2024, he released his 12th album, _[Blue Electric Light](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_Electric_Light "Blue Electric Light")_, which was supported by a world tour with the same name. ## Other work ### Photography and collaboration with Leica Kravitz has partnered with [Leica](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leica_Camera "Leica Camera") on two occasions: in 2015, a Leica M-P edition titled "The Correspondent", and again in 2019 with a Monochrom edition titled "Drifter".[\[63\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-64)[\[64\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-65) ### Kravitz Design Kravitz Design is a New York City–based company founded by Kravitz in 2003.[\[65\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-nytimes-66) Kravitz Design focuses on commercial, residential and product creative direction and design.[\[65\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-nytimes-66) Among its clients are the [Morgans Hotel Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morgans_Hotel_Group "Morgans Hotel Group"), [Swarovski Crystal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swarovski_Crystal "Swarovski Crystal"), and The Setai Group.[\[66\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-67) Swarovski selected Kravitz Design in 2005 and 2006 to participate in their Crystal Palace Collection.[\[67\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-68) Kravitz Design also envisioned a luxury recording studio for The Setai Resort and Residences in [Miami Beach](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miami_Beach,_Florida "Miami Beach, Florida"), New York, Paris, and [New Orleans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Orleans "New Orleans").[\[68\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-69) In 2010, Kravitz Design collaborated with Flavor Paper wallpaper on the Tropicalismo Collection, a line inspired by Brazil's [Tropicalia art movement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropic%C3%A1lia "Tropicália") of the late 1960s.[\[69\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-70) ## Personal life [![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/33/Zoe_Kravitz_and_Lenny_Kravitz_at_the_25th_Spirit_Awards_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Zoe_Kravitz_and_Lenny_Kravitz_at_the_25th_Spirit_Awards_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Zoe_Kravitz_and_Lenny_Kravitz_at_the_25th_Spirit_Awards_(cropped).jpg) Kravitz with his daughter [Zoë](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz "Zoë Kravitz") in March 2010 In 1985, Kravitz met actress [Lisa Bonet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisa_Bonet "Lisa Bonet") backstage at a concert in California.[\[70\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-SPIN-71) They were close friends for two years before beginning a relationship.[\[70\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-SPIN-71) In 1987, Kravitz moved back to New York City, to move in with Bonet.[\[71\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-huffpost-72) They eloped in [Las Vegas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Las_Vegas "Las Vegas") on November 16, 1987, her 20th birthday.[\[70\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-SPIN-71) Kravitz, still known as Romeo Blue at the time, found himself in the headlines of tabloids. He and Bonet had a daughter, [Zoë Isabella Kravitz](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz "Zoë Kravitz"), on December 1, 1988,[\[72\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-73) who became an actress, singer and model. Kravitz and Bonet separated in 1991.[\[34\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-behindthemusic-35) They divorced amicably in 1993.[\[71\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-huffpost-72) Kravitz dated French singer and model [Vanessa Paradis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vanessa_Paradis "Vanessa Paradis") from 1991 to 1996.[\[73\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-74)[\[74\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-75) He began dating Brazilian model [Adriana Lima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adriana_Lima "Adriana Lima") in 2001,[\[75\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ISTO%C3%89-76) and they lived together before becoming engaged in 2002.[\[75\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ISTO%C3%89-76) The engagement was called off in August 2003.[\[75\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-ISTO%C3%89-76)[\[76\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-77)[\[77\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-78) Lima was featured in the music video for Kravitz's 2002 single " [Yesterday Is Gone (My Dear Kay)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yesterday_Is_Gone_(My_Dear_Kay) "Yesterday Is Gone (My Dear Kay)")".[\[78\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-79) He briefly dated and was engaged to Australian actress [Nicole Kidman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicole_Kidman "Nicole Kidman") from 2003 to 2004.[\[79\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-80) Kravitz identifies himself as a Christian in a religious sense "through choice" but stated: "I'm also a Jew. It's all the same to me."[\[80\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-81) During another interview, he stated: "I'm half Jewish, I'm half black, I look in-between."[\[81\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-82) He notes that spirituality "has been an important issue in \[his\] growth", citing his upbringing by parents of different faiths.[\[82\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-83) Such spirituality is prominently featured in many of his songs, such as the lyrics on his album _Baptism_, and a tattoo on his back which is inscribed with "My Heart Belongs to Jesus Christ".[\[83\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-84) In 2011, he stated that his 2005 religious commitment to remain [celibate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_abstinence "Sexual abstinence") until remarriage was unchanged. In a 2014 interview with _[Men's Health](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_Health "Men's Health")_, however, he reconsidered his previous stance.[\[84\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-85)[\[85\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-86)[\[86\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-87) In 2024, Kravitz reaffirmed his desire to remain celibate once again, stating that it was his father's infidelity that inspired him to make a change. "After the marriage, \[to ex-wife Lisa Bonet\] I became more like him. I was becoming a player... I didn't like it. I didn't want to be that guy. So I had to tackle that and it took years... by taking responsibility. Discipline. Not letting my own desires take over."[\[87\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-kravitzcelibacy-88) Kravitz stated in the same interview that he had not been in a romantic relationship for 9 years at that point.[\[87\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-kravitzcelibacy-88)[\[88\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-89) He owns a house in Paris,[\[89\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-90) a farm compound in Brazil,[\[90\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-91) and a trailer with the surrounding land in [The Bahamas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Bahamas "The Bahamas").[\[91\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-BahamasFood-92) He follows [veganism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veganism "Veganism")[\[92\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-93) with a primarily [raw vegan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raw_foodism#Raw_veganism "Raw foodism") diet,[\[91\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-BahamasFood-92) and uses his land in Brazil and The Bahamas to grow his own food.[\[91\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-BahamasFood-92) [PETA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People_for_the_Ethical_Treatment_of_Animals "People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals") named Kravitz one of the Most Beautiful Vegan Celebrities of 2022.[\[93\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-94) On August 25, 2001, singer and actress [Aaliyah](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaliyah "Aaliyah") died in a plane crash in the Bahamas, following the ending of the video shoot to single " [Rock the Boat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rock_the_Boat_(Aaliyah_song) "Rock the Boat (Aaliyah song)")". When the video's choreographer [Fatima Robinson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fatima_Robinson "Fatima Robinson") and dancers were too afraid to get on their plane to get back to the United States, Kravitz (Robinson's friend) sent his private jet to bring them home.[\[94\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenny_Kravitz#cite_note-95) ## Legacy A street has been named after Lenny Kravitz in [Saint-Jean-d'Heurs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saint-Jean-d%27Heurs "Saint-Jean-d'Heurs"), a rural commune of [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France
